entry.title: Simplify DNS management using Route 53 Profiles

link.title: Simplify DNS management using Route 53 Profiles

entry.content:
20 June 2024

Simplify DNS management using Route 53 Profiles

Hosts:
Riggs

Guests:
Adhish Bhobe, Sr. Product Manager
Anusha Burla, Sr. Software Dev Engineer

Abstract:
Sharing and managing Route 53 resources and settings across your organization can quickly get complex and costly, as you scale to multiple VPCs and accounts. In this session of the Routing Loop, we will introduce Route 53 Profiles, a new capability that allows you to create a standard DNS configuration that may include one or more Route 53 private hosted zones, Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall rule groups, and/or Resolver rules, and share the configuration across your VPCs and AWS accounts. Route 53 Profiles simplifies the management and association of Route 53 resources and settings across your organization, by enforcing a consistent configuration.

Session hasn't started. Join live on 20 June 2024 at 10:30AM PST / 1:30PM EST / 6:30PM GMT

Video on demand will become available soon after the livestream

entry.title: Getting to know Amazon VPC IP Address Manager

link.title: Getting to know Amazon VPC IP Address Manager

entry.content:
23 May 2024

Getting to know Amazon VPC IP Address Manager

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel, Matt Lehwess

Guests:
Raunak Tibrewal, Ankit Chadha

Abstract:
Amazon VPC IP Address Manager (IPAM) is a service that simplifies IP address management. This service helps you plan, track, allocate and monitor your IP adddresses in a unified operational view across your AWS environment. Join us for a service overview, and live demonstration
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Streamlining Your Network: AWS Cloud WAN and Cisco SD-WAN Integration

link.title: Streamlining Your Network: AWS Cloud WAN and Cisco SD-WAN Integration

entry.content:
23 May 2024

Streamlining Your Network: AWS Cloud WAN and Cisco SD-WAN Integration

Hosts:
Matt Lehwess, Jamie Wenzel

Guests:
AWS & Cisco

Abstract:
Join our session with experts from AWS and Cisco as they walk you through the integration of AWS Cloud WAN with Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN. Learn about each solution, discover how they work together, and see how you can manage AWS Cloud WAN using Cisco SD-WAN. We'll also include a live demo.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Approaching security and identity with cloud networking

entry.content:
9 May 2024

Approaching security and identity with cloud networking

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel

Guests:
Everett Hinckley, Principal Security Consultant

Abstract:
In this session we talk about security from a wholistic approach as opposed to configurations on individual services. We will discuss best practices on how to plan, create and manage your security and identity, And what it means and looks like in practice.

Abstract:
Equinix is joining us for the Routing Loop this week. In this session, we will dive deep into the capabilities Equinix provides as a AWS Direct Connect partner to provide connectivity for hybrid workloads. entry.title: Securing your applications against web threats with AWS WAF

link.title: Securing your applications against web threats with AWS WAF

entry.content:
24 April 2024

Securing your applications against web threats with AWS WAF

Hosts:
Sidhartha Chauhan

Guests:
Oleksandr Golovatyi, Sr Technical Account Manager
Sagar Desarda, US Tech Leader, Edge-Services

Abstract:
AWS WAF provides a multitude of capabilities for protecting your internet-facing applications. In this session, learn how applications fronted by Amazon CloudFront, Application Load Balancer, Amazon API Gateway, and other AWS services can be protected through seamless integration with AWS WAF. Get additional insights into AWS WAF configuration best practices to help secure your application at an optimal cost.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

Ingress inspection architectures on AWS

Hosts:

Guests:

Abstract:
Join to learn about different firewall deployments for your Internet facing applications. We'll cover network inspection basics and patterns for deployment of AWS WAF, AWS Network Firewall and 3rd party appliances. Expect a demo - time permitting.
